akas: Dolph Lundgrens Take the tower Sweden
akas from release info: Dolph Lundgrens Take the tower Sweden

1.title: Episode #1.1
1.plot: A family from Wales takes on Dolph's traps and puzzles, including the iconic scene from Mission: Impossible (1996), to win a paid trip to New York. But will they all make it considering that their knowledge of film turns out to be less than ideal?

2.title: Episode #1.2
2.plot: Four friends compete to win a paid trip to New York City by answering film and other trivia questions before Dolph's traps, including the spinning wheel of doom, a timed toilet bomb, and a poison gas chamber, take them all out one by one.

3.title: Episode #1.3
3.plot: Kirsty, a tough taxi controller from Glasgow, her daughter and two nephews take on Dolph's challenges including the Mission Impossible scene and the toilet bomb, but Dolph warns them that in his game good guys don't always win.

4.title: Episode #1.4
4.plot: Sid, an energized ticket inspector from London, and his three action film buff colleagues take on Dolph's challenges with surprising efficiency. Has Dolph met his match or is he simply planning to mercilessly take them all out by himself?

5.title: Episode #1.5
5.plot: Four friends who met working at an outdoor clothing and equipment retailer take on Dolph's challenges. They have a rocky start, but as the saying goes - no pain, no gain.

6.title: Episode #1.6
6.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

imdb.plot outline: To win a paid trip to New York City and a cash prize, a geared up contestant and his or her three teammates, usually film buff friends or family members, must reach the top of the tower where the evil gamemaster, action movie legend Dolph Lundgren, awaits them for the final challenge, a shooting duel game. On each floor, one of the contestant's teammates is kidnapped by Dolph's henchmen or put in some other kind of danger. The contestant then must win physical challenges, logic puzzles or trivia quizzes mostly based on action movies to rescue them. If the contestant fails, their teammate is "killed off" by Dolph, who first taunts the victim and then, after delivering a one-liner or one of his movie catchphrases, pushes him or her through his penthouse window to their "death." The teammate that gets "killed off" can not collect the prize even if their team does win at the end. Being the team leader, the contestant is the only one who can not get kidnapped, and who will reach the top of the tower for the final duel with Dolph even if they lose all of their teammates to Dolph's death traps in the process. If the contestant loses to Dolph, the game is still lost even if the contestant manages to rescue all three of his or her teammates.
imdb.title: Take the Tower
plot: To win a prize, four contestants must reach the top of a tower by taking on challenges, puzzles and quizzes drawing on action movies and their tropes, and then face the evil gamemaster himself, action legend Dolph Lundgren.

To win a paid trip to New York City and a cash prize, a geared up contestant and his or her three teammates, usually film buff friends or family members, must reach the top of the tower where the evil gamemaster, action movie legend Dolph Lundgren, awaits them for the final challenge, a shooting duel game. On each floor, one of the contestant's teammates is kidnapped by Dolph's henchmen or put in some other kind of danger. The contestant then must win physical challenges, logic puzzles or trivia quizzes mostly based on action movies to rescue them. If the contestant fails, their teammate is "killed off" by Dolph, who first taunts the victim and then, after delivering a one-liner or one of his movie catchphrases, pushes him or her through his penthouse window to their "death." The teammate that gets "killed off" can not collect the prize even if their team does win at the end. Being the team leader, the contestant is the only one who can not get kidnapped, and who will reach the top of the tower for the final duel with Dolph even if they lose all of their teammates to Dolph's death traps in the process. If the contestant loses to Dolph, the game is still lost even if the contestant manages to rescue all three of his or her teammates.
